bibl.title: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Henry Rose Carter, May 12, 1921

div1.p: Connor discusses administrative issues related to the yellow fever work in Peru, mentioning Rose, Pareja and Hanson. He believes that Carter should not return to Peru, but rather should stay in the U.S.

div1.head: Letter from Michael E. Connor to Henry Rose Carter, May 12, 1921
div1.opener:
R
Connor
Merida, Yue. Mex,
May 12 - 1921
My dear Doctor Carter
div1.p:
Your letter of April 26-
together with enclosures came today.
I thank you for correcting the synopsis
of my final article sent you. I have
no idea who did it, but probably
some one in the publisher's office
I am especially pleased that you
mentioned Converse and Beverleys
work-

Dr. Rose has written me about
Ecuador and Peru- I am replying
that he should appoint a Director
for yellow fever control for S. A. that
who would supervise all work in
Peru and Ecuador. Pareja is a
good man and could do the
work if he did not have so
2
many “parientes” in the city and
unfortunately they all live in the
former endemic zone - and the
vast majority of them will not
allow the Inspectors into their
homes- while Hanson is a
good man, frankly I am afraid
that his family duties are going
to keep him in Lima when he
should be elsewhere - and as
you know one has to be on
the spot and a little beyond to
beat yellow fever- My idea of
a Director for this particular
job would be a man who
could be a general-Inspector
and in places where he would
be most needed and with
funds available from the Foundation
the work would not lag at any
point. Dr. Rose mentioned that
you offered to return to Peru.
I am going to tell him that this
would be imposing on you and further
that his organization at the
present time has no strategist
except your-self and that your
resources should be conserved.
You won't feel that I am exceeding
the bounds of friendship in doing
this?

The work in Yucatan is progressing
nicely and the present indications
are that we shall pass this
rainy season with-out a case.
I shall write you again telling
how the financial crisis here in moving
people away from here was a
principal factor in controlling the
situation.
div1.closer:
With sincere good wishes to you
and yours, M E Connor. I will be anxious to know what
you decide to do.
M E C
